Class PetriNet

java.lang.Object
io.github.leobeaumont.PetriNet
All Implemented Interfaces:
IPretriNet
public class PetriNet extends Object implements IPretriNet
Represents a Petri net system composed of places, transitions, and edges. A Petri net models a distributed system where tokens move between places through transitions according to defined rules.

This class implements IPretriNet and provides functionality to:

  • Add or remove places, transitions, and edges
  • Set and modify weights and token counts
  • Validate the structure of the Petri net
  • Execute and simulate transitions

Supported edge types include WeightedEdgeIn, WeightedEdgeOut, EdgeEmpty, and EdgeZero.

  • Constructor Details

    • PetriNet

      public PetriNet()
      Constructs an empty Petri net.

      Uses ArrayList for internal collections since it provides efficient iteration and insertion at the end, which suits typical Petri net usage.

      public void stepSimulation(Transition transition) throws IllegalArgumentException

      Specified by:
      stepSimulation in interface IPretriNet
      Parameters:
      transition - the transition to fire
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the transition cannot currently be drawn

      public void setWeight(Edge edge, int weight) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Sets the weight of a given weighted edge.
      Specified by:
      setWeight in interface IPretriNet
      Parameters:
      edge - the edge to modify
      weight - the new weight
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the edge is not an instance of WeightedEdgeIn or WeightedEdgeOut

      Sets the weight of a weighted output edge.
      Parameters:
      edge - the weighted output edge
      weight - the new weight

    • isValid

      public boolean isValid()
      Validates the Petri net structure.
      • Each transition must have at least one incoming or outgoing edge.
      • Each edge must have both an origin and an arrival node.
      Returns:
      true if the Petri net is valid, false otherwise

    • drawable

      public List<Transition> drawable()
      Returns a list of all drawable (firable) transitions in the Petri net.
      Specified by:
      drawable in interface IPretriNet
      Returns:
      a list of transitions that can currently be drawn

    • launchSimulation

      public void launchSimulation(int steps)
      Executes a simulation for a specified number of steps.

      At each step, a random drawable transition is selected and drawn.

      Specified by:
      launchSimulation in interface IPretriNet
      Parameters:
      steps - the number of steps to simulate
